replies.bodyText:
Not referencing public key here so it is not added to secrets.
Looking at this https://blog.sonatype.com/2010/01/how-to-generate-pgp-signatures-with-maven/ it looks fine to have pgp signing key with gpg passphrase and names need not be consistent.
The passphrase seems to be generated for the private key only.
@vrozov Am I missing something?
replies.author: sujithvm

replies.bodyText:
Not referencing public key here so it is not added to secrets.

Correct, I replied to @gaiksaya in response to

Yes that's right @sujithvm along with pgp public key


Looking at this https://blog.sonatype.com/2010/01/how-to-generate-pgp-signatures-with-maven/ it looks fine to have pgp signing key with gpg passphrase and names need not be consistent.

There is only (pgp/gpg) signing key that is protected by (pgp/gpg) password. If you refer to it as a pgp key, should not it be pgp password/passphrase? Note that gpg is one of implementations of pgp spec, so it will be better either to use implementation (gpg) or spec (pgp) to refer to a (private) key and it's passphrase.
